result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Collins Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

**CORRECTED 01-12-2016 to add expungement verbiage**
Concurrent with: 14CF452

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized.  Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must have psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy J Collins in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ch. 950 does not apply in these matters. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. 14CF452-2 yrs i/s WPS - 2 yrs prob; 14CF1568 & 15CF816 - 2 yrs WPS I/S - 2 yrs prob. If revoked, time to run consec to each other; no alc/cs-UA's, AODA, FT emp, 6 mos RCJ w/huber.

Defense ask that the Court consider expungement. 

BTC: 14CF452 - sent w/held on all three matters - 2 yrs probation. Matters may be expunged if probation is successfully completed. 

Conditions:
RCJ=CFTS
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
ZCI costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
Psych exam if approp, follow through with any recommendations
FT emp/school = FT

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP
TO BE CO SIGNED WITH LASONJIA SMITH

TO BE CO-SIGNED WITH LASONJIA SMITH, DOB _____________________ WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jeremy J Collins in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Jeremy J Collins in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to 14CF452, State recommends 2 yrs I/S prison equal bifurcation-2 yrs prob. In 14CF1568-State recommends 2 yrs I/S WPS equal bifurcation-2 yrs probation, 15CF816-Ct 2, Ct 1 is DRI State recommends 2 yrs I/S WPS equal bifurcation-2 yrs prob. If revoked, the I/S time is consec to each other. No alc/cs-UA's, AODA assess, FT emp, counseling approp by agent; 6 mos RCJ with huber and other approp conditions. 13CM299 and 14CF1323 will be DRI.
P-G to all 3
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense asks for bond to be modified to signature or co-signature bond.  Defendant's mother,  Lasonjia T. Smith 07-11-1965. The Court conducts colloquy with the potential co-signer. The State believes some cash is required.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Bonds may be modified to co-signature bond with mother. Deft must be compliant with every rule in mother's home. All other conditions remain.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
